metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10883 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ext4 filesystem. A local user can cause an out-of-bounds write in jbd2_journal_dirty_metadata(), a denial of service, and a system crash by mounting and operating on a crafted ext4 filesystem image. Wen Xu discovered that the ext4 file system implementation in the Linux kernel could possibly perform an out of bounds write when updating the journal for an inline file. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious ext4 image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1038-aws - 4.4.0-1038.41
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1037-azure - 4.15.0-1037.39~14.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-142-generic - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-lowlatency - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-142-generic - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1037-azure - 4.15.0-1037.39~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-142-generic - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-lowlatency - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-142-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-142-generic - 4.4.0-142.168~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> possible reproducer in bug report

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1038.41').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39~14.04.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
